note.p: Career: Came to England as a child with his family who were Huguenot refugees; naturalised British (1698); Surgeon, 1st Dragoon Guards (to 1715, 1727-1739); served at Blenheim; Serjeant Surgeon to George II (1729); Surgeon, St George's Hospital, London (1733-1738)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; NBG; Agnew; Hirsch; Foster (son's entry); Dalton; Peterken; Thomas; Thomson
P Fontes da Costa, 'The Culture of Curiosity at The Royal Society in the first half of the eighteenth century', NR 2002 vo l56 pp 147-166

Notes: Proposed by James Douglas. Admitted 19/04/1716. Amyand's candidacy was approved at Council 5/4/1716 with those of others who were elected that day, but his name does not appear in the minutes as having been elected, although he was admitted two weeks later. Hirsch gives date of death as 1745
